page.title: 16Local History
page.content: The name of the village now called Cheddleton was Celtetone (settlement of the Celts) in Domesday 1253 - Chelton , 14-15C Chedulfston, in 1529 Chedelton, later Chedylton or Chedulton. the present spelling was first noticed in 1641 in connection with Star chamber - Cheddleton. The stocks are situated in the Eastern Wall of the churchyard opposites the Black Lion Inn. There are a few ancient crosses in the area and appear to be landmarks roughly one mile in the direction from Dieulacress Abbey to Croxden Abbey.One is a butter cross where villagers in the time of the Plague could purchase farm produce without coming into contact with the farmers.
